Time proves Gothel's worries unnecessary. Minutes later and no one has come. With all the struggling, Aurora's glossy hair has become a mess. Her robe has come half off. Finally, Maisei and Theresa stops, as they are afraid that they would break Aurora if the torment continues.

Aurora collapses on the table. She cannot even move one finger at this moment. The most powerful witch in the world now cannot even fight against the strength of a three-year old kid.

"Humph! You should know how I feel when you tickled my feet earlier!" Theresa snorts and stumps again.

"Alright, alright, Theresa, let her rest for a few minutes then I need to ask her something." Speaking, Gothel stands up and walks to Aurora.

(In case some of you do not know, Aurora is the name of Sleeping Beauty, if I recall correctly)
141112111111111111111111.title: The long awaited payback

choices: Theresa and Maisei begin their journey in the world of Oz
1411121111111111111111111.content:
"Aurora, I am sure the girls have given you enough. I do wish to tickle you myself, but before that, I need some answers from you. Of course, depending on your responses, the intensity may vary." Gothel takes the gloves off her hands, one after another, lightly pinching Aurora's big toe.

"Wait....wait..." Aurora is at the verge of broken, drooling. Gasping with all her strength, she continues speaking. "I will tell you everything. Just no more....please." If Aurora is conscious enough, she would be regretting including the rules that sensitivity of a witch grows with her talent. Indeed, being the most talented witch herself, the sensitivity of her body is paramount.

"Where is my husband? How can I get him back?" Gothel asks apathetically. Over the years, she has been suffering from this for too long and she has learned to stay apathetic so that she does not fall into despair.

"He... He is in Cinderella's world. I have mistaken the power of inter-dimensional barrier. It prevents connection between two worlds from occurring more than once." Still weak, Aurora answer.

"Why? How can I get him back!?" Even though Gothel has anticipated this being the result, she still cannot accept the fact that her lover will never come back. She starts to lose patience.

"Calm down, Gothel! I can explain! No more, please, no more." Seeing that Gothel is losing patience, Aurora tries to appease her. She quickens her speech. "Intrusion among worlds is unnatural, and the laws from nature prohibits this from occurring. Even though natural breach could occur occasionally, artificial portals trigger nature's immunity system. Once an artificial portal between two world opens, nature senses it and closes it permanently."

"Focus on the key point. HOW CAN I GET HIM BACK?" Gothel strikes the table on which Aurora lies with fury. A loud banging sound echoes in the chamber. Maisei and Theresa are scared by Gothel's sudden burst. Holding each others' hands, the two girls backs away, trembling.

"Wait! It is possible! I can tell you!" Aurora speaks in fear.

"SPEAK!" Gothel demands.

"If we could use a natural medium that is permitted to travel between worlds, we could potentially travel to the same world again!" Aurora speaks hastily.

"Do you know where to find it?" Gothel inhales deeply, trying to calm down.

"Yes, yes. In case of incidents that could have ruined my master plan, I prepared a backup plan that could allow me to traverse among worlds freely. In the world of Oz, there are a pair of gems possessing the power of space. Even with hundreds of millions of people knowing my stories and enhancing the worlds, only one pair of these gems could exist among all worlds - that is how rare they are and how strict nature is on inter-dimensional traveling. When the two gems are placed in close proximity, they have domination over space. Do remember, on if they are together - having only one of the two gems will not work." Aurora has finally caught her breath.

"Send us there, right away!" Gothel demands again.

"The story of Oz has not been spread widely enough yet. At this moment, the portal could only allow two young ones to cross before it collapses. However, before I do that, tell me, how did you get in here?" The remnant fear of tickling has diminished. Knowing that Gothel still needs her, Aurora has gained some confidence.

"You are in no place to bargain." Gothel's pointy nails scratches over bottom of Aurora's soles. The poor witch scrunches her toes and laughter burst.

"Hahaha--Stop---Hahaha--Or---Hahahaha--I won't do---Hahaha--it--" During laughter, Aurora squeezes out her intimidation.

"Tch. I guess we still need you." Gothel stops. She waves her hand at Theresa, signaling her to come. The two girls are still holding their hands together, scared or the earlier furious Gothel.

"It is okay, Theresa, come over here~" Gothel tries to be as friendly and amiable as possible, but Theresa still seems to be scared.

"I am sorry girls, I went over my head, and the anger was not even for you. Forgive me, alright? I just need you to show Aurora the runes I drew between your toes." Gothel appeases the girls. Theresa nods to comes close.

"Alright dear, take off one shoe first." Gothel instructs.

"Hey those are mine!" Aurora protests.

"Not anymore, and you will not need them anymore. The association has sentenced deprivation of your rights to possess or wear any footwear for the entirety of your natural life, or until you make another major breakthrough for the association, whichever comes first." Gothel declares.

"Who gave you the right of sentencing!? I am still the head of association!" Aurora objects loudly.

"When your speech was broadcast to the public a little while ago, your behavior was determined treason and re-election was held immediately at the association. With my reputation and my merit, the members of association reached consent almost instantly." Gothel responds.

"Ex---Excuse me...My foot feels cold." Theresa mumbles.

"Oh--right. Just spread your toes a little bit." Gothel speaks amiably.

"That's....brilliant!" Although still bounded on the table, Aurora exclaims.

"Yes, a rune forms when all the lines are connected - that is when Theresa scrunches her toes. On this foot is the rune for transmitting voice, and on the other one is the rune for summoning us. And Theresa, you can put your boot back on now." Gothel explains.

"...You have outsmarted me. Alright, relieve me from these magic-damping straps and I will cast the magic." Aurora speaks.

"Not so fast. I just need one insurance." Gothel reaches into her pocket and pulls out a quill.

"What...what are you doing!? Stop! Hahahaha---No---" Aurora bursts into laughter once again when the quill makes contact with her left sole.

"I will activate the rune and you will experience tickling hundreds of times more intense than what you are experiencing right now if you do anything suspicious. Before you even think about trying, if I do not lift the spell in time, the rune will activate on its own and will not stop until the ink fades. Hint, this ink can only be erased with a special solution. So, do not try anything fishy and you will be just fine." Gothel speaks as the quill rapidly drifts up and down, all over Aurora's sole.

"You----Hahaha---bitch---Hahahaha!" Aurora curses.

"I could make this a more ticklish experience if you do not keep quite." Gothel speaks. Several minutes later, two complex runes appear on Aurora's soles.

"Now we can release you." Gothel loosens the straps and Aurora quickly pulls her hands and feet out of them, not wishing to stay in them for even one more second.

"Do you thing." Gothel demands.

"Now?" Aurora asks.

"Right away." Gothel looks at the two girls. In her eyes are begging and apologies. She walks to Theresa and Maisei and speaks. "Please, I cannot wait any longer. I wish I could go in there myself but I guess I have to, once again, lay the burdens on you. I will prepare you two the most glorious ceremony and finest gifts upon your return, but now, please, help me!" Gothel bows at the two girls. A strong woman like her probably has never done that to anyone.

"Alright. I guess this is for me as well. After all, I need them to help me return home." Theresa stares at Gothel in her eyes. "And do not forget those gifts you talked about!"

"My share too." Maisei complements.

On the other side, Aurora is casting the spell. She mumbles some mysterious words while magic circles fly around her. A gate slowly forms.

"We will see you again soon." The two girls speak, ready to step through the gate.

"Wait." Gothel stops them.

"Don't be so sentimental now, we will come back, soon." Maisei smiles at Gothel.

"Just give me a few minutes." Gothel speaks, and with a magic circle under her feet appearing, she disappears. A minutes later, Gothel returns with Theresa's boots.

"Here you are. I guess walking in shoes a size too large in another world is not the best idea." Gothel speaking, handing Theresa's furry boots to her.

"Just walk through the gate already! I cannot hold it any longer." Aurora seems to be struggling trying to keep the gate open.

With one hand holding her boots and the other hand holding Maisei's hand, Theresa walks through the gate. Immediately after Maisei follows through it, the gate collapse. So does Aurora. She lies on the cold floor, gasping.

"I am not doing this again!" Aurora claims.

"On your behalf, your sentence may be mitigated." Gothel speaks. Her words are still cold but one could hear hope in it.

"What if they do not come back?" Aurora suddenly asks.

"I....trust them." Gothel replies.
1411121111111111111111111.title: Gothel asks Aurora about traveling between worlds

choices: Stay at the village for one night
14111211111111111111111111.content:
The breach in the world of Oz opens. At the same time, a loud banging sound blares. Theresa and Maisei walks out of the breach and shortly, it collapse into thin air. Theresa rubs her forehead to help relieve the dizziness from inter-dimensional teleportation while Maisei seems to be quite alright. People's exclamations pull Theresa's thoughts back to reality. Not far from the two girls lies a pretty lady and her broom.

"Did we do that? Should we run?" Theresa whispers to Maisei, looking at the crowd surrounding them.

"I don't know. The people seem to be scared but relieved at the same time. Proceed to escape sequence if anomaly occurs." Maisei says.

"What?" Theresa displays a what-the-hell-are-you-talking-about face. Her mouth opens excessively wide to exaggerate the expression.

"That means run if something goes wrong, dumb dumb." Maisei whispers back.

"Cough cough. Did... did you two young ladies slay this evil witch?" An old man who seems the elder of the village steps forward and points at the pretty lady.

"I... guess?" Theresa replies, but even herself is unsure about the answer.

"The goddess has finally replied to our prayers! She has finally sent her angels to slay the evil witch for us!" The old man suddenly kneels and start saying prayers.

"Did we do it?" Theresa whispers to Maisei.

"Possibly. Gothel did tell me that this type of superior magic tends to disturb magic elements around the area, preventing weaker witches from using magic. Maybe she just happened to be flying and lost control due to this." Maisei whispers back.

"Make sense. From what I read in the past, the shoes she is wearing is what we need, right?" Theresa asks again.

"Maybe. The version I heard said that her crystal slippers contains the power of space, but if it does contain the power, why does she not use it?" Maisei thinks, soon replies.

"We can try it, then we will know." Theresa speaks.

"My apologies, my brave heroines. In the name of goddess, we appreciate your arrival to our village and slaying the evil witch!" The old man has stood back up while the two girls are whispering at each others.

"Our tiny village does not have much to offer for you two brave ladies. If you would like, you could take the crystal slippers the witch wears. It is said that these slippers possess outstanding magic power." The old man speaks again.

"It is very kind of you to offer, sir. Their power could be very helpful for our next mission." Maisei steps forward and replies.

"You, you must be on your journey to defeat the Witch in the west! You are truly brave!" The old man exclaims.

"It is so unfortunate that we could not give you much help. Please, have these bread. The are freshly made and should at least satisfy your stomach." The old man signals at one of the villagers. The villager runs into his house and soon returns with a loaf of bread.

"We'd gladly accept this. Thank you!" Maisei replies to the old man and takes the loaf of bread. She hands the bread over to Theresa and walks towards the Witch.

"Can you see I am already holding my boots? Do you have to occupy both of my hands?" Theresa complains, but Maisei knows that Theresa is only trying to give her a hard time, in a friendly way.

"You just have to complain, don't you?" Maisei turns around and smiles at Theresa before she strips the Witch's crystal slippers off. She carefully examines the slippers. Both of them are made of completely transparent crystal, which protects their wearer but put the wearer's feet on a display - considering how easily they come off, its purpose is likely more for display than for protection. On tip of each slipper is a small gouge for jewelry. On the left slipper, the gouge is filled with a ruby while on the right one the gouge remains unfilled.

"You must be kidding me. I am not wearing this!" Theresa sees the slippers. Immediately she start protesting. From afar, she could not clearly see the difference between the two slippers. Without anyone noticing, Maisei removes the ruby from the slipper and drops it into her pocket. She has realized that the ruby is the key, not the slippers. However, part of her wants to see Theresa struggle with putting on a pair of transparent slippers.

"This is going to be fun. I will tell her about the gem later." Maisei mumbles to herself.

"Should we hit the road again?" Theresa asks from afar.

"Alright. Let's get going." Maisei nods.

"Wait, why not stay for one night here?" The old man asks. He seems to have thought of something.

"It is alright. We do not have much time." Theresa replies.

"Please, I insist." The old man speaks.
14111211111111111111111111.title: Oz! Witch!?

choices: A picnic blanket lies on the grass not far from them
141112111111111111111111112.content:
"We truly appreciate your good will but we have to leave!" Maisei says. Before the old man could react, Maisei grabs Theresa on her right wrist and starts running. Theresa stumbles as the boots on her feet are of the best fit, but she manages to keep her balance. Knowing that Maisei must have a good reason behind this, Theresa stays silent and sprints with Maisei. Seeing so, the crowd splits in half, leaving a path for the girls to exit. The old man's mouth opens, as if he is about to say something, but soon closes and lightly shakes his head. After the two girls are gone, the crowd soon disperses. The old man walks back into his house and starts writing:
"The mighty and powerful Elphaba, I have acquired clues of Evanora [Witch of East] and her crystal shoes. However, two strange girls traverses through a portal and somehow disrupted her magic, indirectly causing her death. I attempted to lower their caution by offering the crystal shoes, which they gladly took. However, I was still unable to seize them. They are currently heading east and should encounter the territory of mimics soon. I cannot determine how long they will be delayed. Please send reinforcement soon."

On the other hand, the two girls are chatting as they walk.

"What was the rush just now? We could have stayed. It would be great if we could stay for the night. I knew you must have a good reason." Theresa asks.

"The Elder of that village is planning something fishy. I could see it from his eyes. The rest of the villagers, on the other hand, do not seem to know anything." Maisei explains.

"But, what could he possibly be going after, the slippers, or us?" Theresa is confused.

"Logically, us. He would not have offered the slippers if he wanted them. However, my instinct tells me that he is after the slippers." Maisei says.

"But we should be fine since you are wearing your red.... wait, I just notice you are not wearing your red hood!" Theresa speaks but soon exclaims, as she finds that Maisei is not wearing her peculiar red hood.

"Right... About that. I left that with Gothel to assure her that we will be back. She never demanded it, but I would like to leave her something as a symbol of trust." Maisei replies.

"Maisei, you are truly a saint." Theresa teases, acting as if she is praying towards Maisei. However internally, she is indeed glad that her friend is such a considerate person who would risk her own well-being for inner peace of others.

"Saying that won't save your sensitive body from this." Noticing that Theresa is teasing, Maisei fights back with her fingers dancing in mid-air, as if she is about to tickle Theresa.

"Hey! That's not fair! And I just recall you are still owing me a good round of tickling!" Theresa says.

"Right, right, where do you want to be tickled, feet again?" Maisei smiles at Theresa, pretending that she does not know what she is talking about.

"No! Me tickling you! Over all your body!" Theresa argues.

"You can try, but I will fight back and give you a good taste of my new techniques." Maisei disagrees.

"Humph, you won't succeed. Actually... Speaking of taste, should we try that bread? I am feeling a little hungry." Theresa asks.

"Sure. Let's find good place to take a rest. You can get your boots changed as well. I saw you stumble earlier. Wearing something that doesn't fit you is probably still a little uncomfortable." Realizing Theresa is still holding her short boots, Maisei suggests.
141112111111111111111111112.title: A place of danger

choices: The mimic gives the girls a thorough "massage"
1411121111111111111111111122.content:
"Hey Theresa, I think someone left a picnic blanket over there." Maisei points.

"Lucky! Let's have our lunch break!" Theresa cheers.

"This is definitely more like dinner break." As the girls are walking toward the picnic blanket, Maisei expresses her view.

"You just have to disagree with me, don't you?" Theresa makes faces at Maisei.

"Silly Theresa." Maisei shakes her head lightly.

The picnic blanket is fairly large - enough to serve a group of five or six people. As Theresa approaches the blanket, she tosses the short boots that she has been holding the entire time aside onto the grass and she rolls onto the picnic blanket.

"Hey Theresa, stop that." Maisei says.

"Come on, I haven't had picnic for so long! It is natural to get excited." Theresa defends for her ungentle behavior.

"Alright, alright." Maisei tosses the crystal slippers right by Theresa's short boots and sits on the picnic blanket. Theresa breaks the loaf of bread in half and hands a half to Maisei.

"This bread is really good!" Theresa exclaims as she chews the bread.

"For once, I agree." Maisei takes a bite.

In a few minutes, the two girls finish their lunch.

"Phew. I like this weather." Theresa lies on picnic blanket to looks up at the clear sky. A cloud hovers over the sun, projecting a shade onto the girls.

"Hey! Don't get it dirty with your shoes! Take them off, show some respect!" Maisei pats Theresa on her head and says.

"Come on Maisei, stop being a mom. I thought you said you want to be my sister, not mother." Theresa stares at Maisei.

"Alright, alright." Maisei lies down by Theresa and stares at the clear sky with her.

"Actually, I haven't been relaxing like this for a very long time either." Maisei sighs.

"When we are done with all these mess, you can return home and be like this all day long." Theresa speaks.

"Maybe, but would my grandmother still be around? To be honest I am scared." Maisei's eyes look watery. "I don't want to be alone."

"You won't be, Maisei. You still have me, you still have Gothel." Theresa comforts her.

"I know... But if grandmother is still around, I will not be able to see you two anymore. For either case, I am scared." Maisei looks at Theresa in her eyes.

"We will figure it out, I promise." Theresa says, looking back at Maisei.

The two girls close their eyes, and when they open their eyes again, the sun is starting to go down.

"Guh, I can't move." Realizing that she, together with Maisei, is wrapped around by the picnic blanket, Theresa moans. She struggles but it was to no avail.

"Something, something soft is crawling around my boots!" Maisei cries out. While the upper part of picnic blanket wraps all the way from the girls' breasts to their thighs, a huge mouth opens at the lower part of the blanket with its tongue extending outside. Spreading all over the tongue are a series bumps of flesh. Each time the tongue licks, the bumps adheres to Maisei's boots. With the tongue retracting, the bumps try to pull Maisei's boots off. Maisei scrunches her toes and tightly clenches to the sole of her boots. The tongues is unable to remove Maisei's protection off with the first round of its attack. Maisei exhales as she survives the first round. She struggles with even greater strength as she knows the second round will come at any time. However, even with Theresa trying at her greatest strength, they could not break free. The second round comes. Maisei clenches to the soles of her boots again. She survives the second round, but her boots has been pull slightly away from her feet. The tongue licks again and again. Each time, the boots are pulled further apart from Maisei's feet. Maisei grows anxious as she feels her protection being torn off. Finally, with a final lick, both of her boots are tugged off at the same time. The tongue wraps around its trophies and returns to the mouth. Shortly after, it strikes again.
1411121111111111111111111122.title: Picnic? Mimic!

14111211111111111111111111221.content:
"No! Give them back to me!" Feeling the breeze on her feet, Maisei cries in fear. Before she could say more, the tongue makes contact with her soles. The bumps brushes against her silky skin and starts secreting fluids.

"Hahaha---Help---Hahaha--Theresa---Hahahaha--Help---Me--Hahaha" Maisei screams with laughter. Her toes have already scrunched together but it was to avail. In fact, Maisei scrunching her toes further excites the creature. The tongue licks at a higher rate.

"Hahahaha---Hahahaha--Help--" Maisei continues laughing and crying for help. It was the only thing she could do. All this time, Theresa is trying to help. Despite knowing that this will provoke the creature, Theresa is trying to poke the tongue with the tip of her toes. Initially, the tongue ignores her. It is have too much joy licking and bring laughter to Maisei to react to Theresa's provoke. After the fourth time, Theresa pokes it. The tongue can no longer stand. It switches target.

Maisei gasps loudly, taking her break, while the tongue starts licking Theresa's boots. It does not take long for Theresa to lose her footwear. With the boots being a size too large, it is much easier for the tongue to pull it off. It is Theresa's turn to laugh. With one sudden stroke of the tongue, Theresa can no longer hold her laughter.

"Hahahaha--No---Hahaha---Fogive---Hahaha--Forgive me--Hahaha" Her laughter is even louder, as the tongue, covered with saliva, brushes up and down on her soles. With the tongue being so much larger than Theresa's feet, it could easier cover Theresa's entire soles. The saliva further lubricates her already extremely soft skin. The bumps make the situation a lot worse. With each lick, Theresa's laughter grows louder. For one brief moment, the sensation is so strong that Theresa fails to keep her toes scrunched together. Catching the chance, the smaller bumps sticks between Theresa's toes so that she could not longer hide the seams. Tears climb all over Theresa's face.

As Theresa is starting to feel the lack of oxygen from all her laughing, the tickling sensation weakens. The tongue is no longer attacking both of feet. Rather, it is only attacking her left foot. At the same time, Maisei's laughter sounds. Surprised and confused, Theresa tilts her right foot downward, finding that something soft is in front of her foot, blocking all the "attack" for her.

"Heeee--Hahaha---Theresa--Hahaha--Stop--Haha--Moving--HeeeHeee--Hahaha-- Your---Hahaha--Foot--" With laughter between words, Maisei finishes her sentence. Knowing that Theresa cannot take all the tickling alone, she sticks her own foot in front of Theresa to help her. Even though afraid of being tickled, she does not wish her friend to bear it all.

Realizing that one girl is helping another, the creature grows further excited. Its tongue swipes from left to right then right to left for a full-area lick. With the tongue and the bumps on it rapidly brushing over their soles, the girls' laughter becomes louder, especially Maisei's. With both of her feet under attack, she is taking twice as much tickling as Theresa is. One minute later, Maisei's laughter gentles down. As Theresa realizes that Maisei will be broken if she continues taking the full tickling strikes, she places her foot in front. Over the next ten minutes, the two girls take place bearing the full attack while the other take a brief break. Certainly, for each of them, one foot is still continuously tickled, but at least it could still be bearable.

Another ten minutes has elapsed and the creature seems satisfied. Its tongue retracts into its mouth and soon the mouth closes. It is like nothing has happened except that the girls are breathing heavily with their feet covered in saliva. The picnic blanket sits quietly under them as if it has never turned into a monster.

Still gasping, the girls rolls off the blanket onto the grass, as they no longer have the courage to stay on a mimic that just took their footwear and gave them a good round of tickling. The girls wipes their feet again the grass turf to remove the saliva. Fortunately enough for the girls, the crystal slippers and Theresa's own shoes are placed far away enough that they were not eaten by the mimic. Theresa slowly crawls to her shorts boots and swiftly places them on her feet, while Maisei stares at the crystal shoes, frowning.

"Theresa, can we switch? Please!!!" Maisei stares at Theresa into her eyes.

"No way! Don't even think! I can assure you my boots won't fit." Theresa refuses.

"Humph! I demand you to switch with me!" Maisei pulls her older-sister face at Theresa. Clearly she has taken enough rest and they both have had enough experience with tickling creatures to recover from this quickly.

"Nope!" Theresa stands back up and wipes the dust off her clothes. "Maybe you should try activate the power of these slippers. They are made of the gems, right?" Maisei asks.

"Actually, they are not..." Maisei sighs and stops joking. "Look at the tips of these slippers, each of them have a place for a gem. Here is the gem, just one." Maisei points at the tips of her slippers, then pulls a ruby out of her pocket

"So, there is another one?" Theresa asks, but her eyes are still staring at Maisei's shoes - more specifically, her feet. The transparent crystal slippers displays Maisei's perfect feet without hiding any details.

"Stop staring! And yes. According to the tale I read, the evil Witch Evanora has always wanted these slippers. However, the other evil witch's power is just as strong as hers. They disliked each other and has fought for many decades. She might be possessing the other gem. Otherwise, why would she want the slippers so much?" Maisei answers with a blush of red on her face.

"That makes sense. If I recall correctly, she is the witch in the east. Maybe we can find her somewhere in the east?" Theresa speaks, but unsure of the answer.

"That would be my guess." Maisei says.

"We better get on the road then. Hopefully we can find something that don't put your feet on the display in the next village." Theresa walks to the road made of golden bricks and looks back at Maisei.

"Wait Theresa... Can you...hold my hand? These slippers have heels and I'm not particularly familiar with these." Maisei's volume goes lower and lower.

"Certainly~" Theresa walks back to Maisei and holds her arm around Maisei's shoulder. "Feeling better now?"

"Thank...you.." Maisei turns her head away and mumbles.
14111211111111111111111111221.title: True friendship fears nothing

info.brief_description: Uncover the darkness behind tales, survive and escape from ticklish torment.
info.description:
Words are spread around town that tales are lies. Some say tales are to entertain children; some say tales are to teach lessons, but the truly wise ones keep the secret to themselves, that tales are to cover the dark truth with sugar coats.

There is a theory: words create worlds. With words flowing onto paper, forming sentences, paragraphs, books, worlds are created. With more details of a world known by more people, connection between worlds can be enhanced. At some point, a breach can be open, allowing some beings to pass from one world to another. However, this opportunity is extremely precious, as worlds repel each other while interaction occurs. After a brief moment, the breach between the two worlds will be closed, forever.

Based on this theory, dark tales were created. An egregious being behind the scene has planned her revival in one of the tales and to gain control of our world. However, accidentally, Theresa is teleported into the tale world instead of his army being teleported main world. How will Theresa survive the crude reality in the tales? How could she escape from the tickling filled in the tales?

Imagination is your gift, be creative and let's put together an extraordinary story!

No blood
Minimal cursing
No M/M or F/M. M/F is allowed
No Sex

Disclaimer:
All content created in this story are merely a work of fiction and should be treated so. All behaviors in the story should not be copied in real-life.

Enjoy

Thank you all for reading!

P.S. The main plot is approaching its ending. Around 3/4 of the story has been told and the remaining 1/4 will focus on the girls' journey in Oz. While my writing skill continues to improve, any feedback regarding the work (language, grammar, plot, wording, etc.) is greatly appreciated. If you have any interesting idea and would like me to incorporate it, you are more than welcome to PM me about it as well.

If you like the story, please shoot me an pm and tell me so!

Special thanks to the ones supporting me:
To begin with, I truly appreciate the membership! More to my gratefulness, I was told that someone does enjoy my story. Writing this type of stories is one hobby of mine, but if it indeed brings joy to others, I'd love to put more effort in writing them!

Again, great appreciations!
